intro: Androstachys subpeltata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Androstachys subpeltata plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
